pbi.title: As a user, I want a global CLI for backlog-chef so that I can process transcripts from anywhere on my system
pbi.description: Implement an OCLIF-based CLI that allows global installation and running of backlog-chef processing commands. The CLI will provide a professional command-line interface for processing meeting transcripts.
acceptance_criteria: User can install globally with "npm install -g backlog-chef"
User can run "backlog-chef process [file]" to process any transcript
Supports TXT, JSON, and XML input formats
Auto-generated help text explains all options
"npm start" still works for local development
Proper error messages when files don't exist or API keys missing
Documentation updated with CLI usage examples

strengths: Specific CLI command and flag requirements
concerns: Potential complexity in supporting multiple input formats
Ensuring backwards compatibility with existing system

risk_flags.message: Multi-format transcript processing introduces significant parsing and validation challenges
Global CLI must maintain backwards compatibility with existing backlog-chef system configurations and workflows
No clear performance benchmarks defined, risking potential scalability issues with large transcript processing
Lack of detailed error handling specifications could lead to poor user experience and debugging challenges

suggestions: Define explicit performance benchmarks for CLI command execution, specifying maximum acceptable latency and memory consumption for transcript processing operations
Develop comprehensive error handling strategy with specific error codes, descriptive messages, and recommended user recovery actions for common failure scenarios
Include configuration options for customizing transcript processing settings directly through CLI flags or a configuration file
Implement logging mechanisms that capture detailed processing events and support multiple verbosity levels for debugging and monitoring
Create a clear specification for supported input transcript formats and any required preprocessing transformations in the CLI workflow
